connectorUiConfig.title: Trellix Endpoint Security (via Codeless Connector Framework)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Trellix Endpoint Security](https://www.trellix.com/) data connector enables you to ingest security events from Trellix ePO (ePolicy Orchestrator) into Microsoft Sentinel. This connector uses OAuth2 client credentials authentication and automatically handles pagination to collect comprehensive endpoint security data including threat detections, analyzer information, source and target system details, and threat response actions.

dataTypes.name: TrellixEvents
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
TrellixEvents
| where TimeGenerated > ago(6h)
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

instructionSteps.title: 1. API Configuration
instructionSteps.description: Configure your Trellix ePO API connection.

parameters.content:
## Authentication

Provide your API key for authentication. This will be sent in the x-api-key header.

parameters.text: The API key will be securely stored and used for authentication with the Trellix ePO API.

parameters.content:
### OAuth2 Configuration
Configure OAuth2 client credentials for API access. Read about the Trellix API authorization model at https://developer.manage.trellix.com/public/mvision/docs/umam

parameters.text: OAuth2 authentication provides secure access to your API endpoints.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Enable Connector
instructionSteps.description: Activate the Trellix Endpoint Security connector

parameters.content:
### Connector Activation

Review your configuration and enable the connector to start collecting security events.

### Post-Connection

After connecting, monitor the connector status in the **Data connectors** page. Data should begin appearing within 5-10 minutes.

schema.name: [variables('_logAnalyticsTableId1')]
schema.description: Trellix Endpoint Security events data collected from the Trellix ePO events API.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (in UTC) when the event was generated.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: Type of the event provided by Trellix.

columns.name: DetectedUtc
columns.description: UTC timestamp at which the event was detected.

columns.name: ReceivedUtc
columns.description: UTC timestamp at which the event was received.

columns.name: SourceHostName
columns.description: Host name of the event source.

columns.name: SourceIPv4
columns.description: IPv4 address of the event source.

columns.name: SourceIPv6
columns.description: IPv6 address of the event source.

columns.name: SourceMac
columns.description: MAC address of the event source.

columns.name: SourceUserName
columns.description: User name of the event source.

columns.name: SourceProcessName
columns.description: Process name of the event source.

columns.name: TargetHostName
columns.description: Host name of the event target.

columns.name: TargetIPv4
columns.description: IPv4 address of the event target.

columns.name: TargetIPv6
columns.description: IPv6 address of the event target.

columns.name: TargetMac
columns.description: MAC address of the event target.

columns.name: TargetUserName
columns.description: User name of the event target.

columns.name: TargetProcessName
columns.description: Process name of the event target.

columns.name: TargetFileName
columns.description: File name of the event target.

columns.name: ThreatHandled
columns.description: Indicates if the threat was handled.
